input_text:
Job Title: CAD Sr Designer

Location: Warsaw, IN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
At Zimmer Biomet, we believe in pushing the boundaries of innovation and driving our mission forward. As a global medical technology leader for nearly 100 years, a patientâ€™s mobility is enhanced by a Zimmer Biomet product or technology every 8 seconds.

As a Zimmer Biomet team member, you will share in our commitment to providing mobility and renewed life to people around the world. To support our talent team, we focus on development opportunities, robust employee resource groups (ERGs), a flexible working environment, location specific competitive total rewards, wellness incentives and a culture of recognition and performance awards. We are committed to creating an environment where every team member feels included, respected, empowered, and recognized.

What You Can Expect

Under the direction of a project leader, responsible for creating and revising solid models and detail drawings using 3-Dimensional modeling tools. Responsible for the integrity of the computer-graphic product and process model databases. These models must be suitable for internal concurrent manufacture, CAE evaluation, CMM data extraction, and vendor translation.

How You'll Create Impact

Works simultaneously with all cross-functional engineers to create complex 3D surfaced or solid models of orthopedic devices.Creates 2D specifications linked directly to the 3D model, with attention to company drafting standards.Develops casting, forging, and any other process models and drawings in partnership with process engineers and CNC programmers.Evaluates device designs using anatomic data.Creates various 2D and 3D deliverables for product managers and marketing communications.Performs complex 3D tolerance analysis ensuring proper fit and function.Manages a portion of the graphics maintenance workload.Complies with existing procedures and standards per the Quality Systems Regulations.

This is not an exhaustive list of duties or functions and may not necessarily comprise all of the "essential functions" for purposes of the ADA.

What Makes You Stand Out

Demonstrated computer graphics skills applicable to orthopaedic product designProficient with Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T), capable of applying GD&T callouts to drawings per ASME Y14.5 in a manner that optimizes inspection, manufacturability, and mating fits.Product design innovation leading to patentable technologyAdapts quickly to new technologies, with involvement in the transition processAbility to balance special assignments and maintenance responsibilities amidst the typical workloadCapable of modifying existing Unigraphics models and drawings, including diagnosing potential issues before they affect the business operationsTranslates design requirements into CAD deliverables, in partnership with an engineers

Your Background

A two-year technical degree or an equivalent combination of education and experienceExperience creating solid models using Unigraphics software for device development 

Travel Expectations

Up to 5%

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disability

1784

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: CAD Sr Designer
output_json.summary: A global medical technology leader seeks a CAD Sr Designer to enhance patient mobility through innovative products.
job_responsibilities: Creating and revising solid models and detail drawings using 3D modeling tools
Ensuring model integrity for internal processes
Working with cross-functional teams for complex model creation
Evaluating device designs using anatomic data
Creating deliverables for product managers and marketing
output_json.company_information: Zimmer Biomet is a global medical technology leader with a history of enhancing patient mobility.
